name: Kentucky National Guard Tuition Award Program
description: 100% tuition at on-campus rates for Kentucky National Guard members. $40,000 lifetime cap at 4-year comprehensive universities. Deadlines: April 1 (fall semester), October 1 (spring semester).
eligibility: Active Kentucky National Guard member in good standing
benefit_amount: 100% tuition at on-campus rates ($40K lifetime cap at 4-year universities)
how_to_apply: Apply through Kentucky National Guard Personnel Services/Education Office by deadlines

name: Dependent Fee Waiver for 100% Disabled Veterans
description: Tuition fee waivers for dependents (spouses and children) of Kentucky veterans who are 100% disabled. Designed for family members to receive education benefits.
eligibility: Dependent (spouse or child) of Kentucky veteran
Veteran must have 100% VA disability rating
how_to_apply: Apply through Kentucky Department of Veterans Affairs

name: Military Retired Pay Income Tax Deduction
description: Veterans can exclude up to $31,110 of military retired pay from Kentucky income tax.
benefit_amount: Up to $31,110 excluded from state income tax
how_to_apply: Claim deduction on Kentucky income tax return

name: Military Disability Retirement Pay Exemption
description: Military disability retirement pay should not be included in taxable income if presented as annuity, pension, or allowance for service-connected injury or disability.
how_to_apply: Exclude from Kentucky income tax return

name: Property Tax Exemption for Disabled and Senior Veterans
description: Totally disabled veterans or veterans 65+ can receive varying levels of property tax exemption based on disability status and age.
benefit_amount: Property tax exemption (varies by disability level and age)
how_to_apply: Apply with local county assessor with VA disability documentation

name: Disabled Sportsman's License
description: Three-year disabled sportsman's license for $12 for Kentucky residents with 50% or higher service-connected disability. Covers hunting, fishing, all deer permits, turkey permits, migratory bird/waterfowl, and trout permits.
eligibility: 50% or higher VA service-connected disability rating
how_to_apply: Apply online through Kentucky Fish & Wildlife Resources with VA disability documentation
source_name: Kentucky Department of Fish & Wildlife Resources

name: Free Hunting/Fishing on Leave
description: Kentucky resident service members on leave for 3 or more days do not need a license to hunt or fish.
eligibility: Must show military ID and leave papers
benefit_amount: FREE hunting and fishing while on leave (3+ days)
how_to_apply: No application needed - show military ID and leave documentation
source_name: Kentucky Department of Fish & Wildlife Resources

name: State Park Camping and Lodging Discount
description: 10% discount for active military and veterans at Kentucky State Park campgrounds for one campsite or rental unit per visit. 100% disabled Kentucky resident veterans can camp or stay FREE for up to 3 nights per year.
eligibility: For FREE nights: Kentucky resident + 100% disabled
Valid military ID or veteran documentation
benefit_amount: 10% discount for all vets; FREE 3 nights/year for 100% disabled KY residents
how_to_apply: Show military ID or veteran documentation at state park

name: Kentucky Veterans' Homes
description: Four state veterans' homes providing skilled nursing care for Kentucky veterans in need. Located throughout the state offering 24-hour care.
eligibility: Priority based on service and disability
how_to_apply: Contact Kentucky Department of Veterans Affairs for admission

name: Kentucky Women Veterans Program
description: Dedicated program ensuring women veterans have equitable access to Kentucky veteran benefits and services. Provides advocacy and support specifically for women veterans.
benefit_amount: Advocacy, support services, and equitable access to benefits
how_to_apply: Contact Kentucky Department of Veterans Affairs Women Veterans Program
